clinical_study.brief_title: Gliflozins and Cardiovascular Risk Factors in Type 2 Diabetes (GIOIA)
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Gliflozins on Markers of Cardiovascular Risk in Type 2 Diabetes (GIOIA): a Multicenter Pragmatic Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: GIOIA represents a multicenter pragmatic prospective cohort study, aimed at evaluating the effects of SGLT2 inhibitors currently marketed (dapagliflozin, canagliflozin, empagliflozin) on markers of vascular, myocardial and renal damage, in patients with type 2 diabetes not well controlled with metformin and/or basal insulin. The changes of the interest outcomes are compared with those obtained with a comparator glucose lowering class (DPP-4inhibitors) over a follow-up of two years.

primary_outcome.description: Progression (increase in mean CIMT in millimeters [mm]) or regression (reduction > o = 0.020 mm on mean CIMT) after 2 years of follow-up

Change from baseline in: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) in percentage (%), Diastolic Left Ventricular Dimension (LVDs) in centimeters (cm) Interventricular Septum thickness (IVS) in cm left vetricular posterior wall thickness (PWs) in cm

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary albumin to creatinine ratio excretion
primary_outcome.description: Development of microalbuminuria in normoalbuminuric patients at baseline or development of macroalbuminuria in patients with microalbuminuria at baseline; regression of microalbuminuria to normoalbuminuria or regression of macroalbuminuria to microalbuminuria

secondary_outcome.description: Change in body weight in kilograms (kg) from baseline
Change in body mass index in Kg/mq from baseline
Change in waist circumference in cm from baseline
Change in systolic and dyastolic blood pressure in mmHg from baseline
Change in estimated glomerular filtration rate in mI/min/1.73 mq from baseline

other_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c in % from baseline
Change in MAGE in mmol/L from baseline
Change in total cholesterol, tryglicerides, HDL-cholesterol, and LDL-cholesterol in mg/dL from baseline

arm_group.description: Type 2 diabetic patients treated with metformin and/or insulin starting therapy with a SGLT-2 inhibitor: dapagliflozin 10 mg, oral, once daily or canagliflozin 100 mg, oral, daily or empagliflozin 10 mg, oral, daily

Type 2 diabetic patients treated with metformin and/or insulin starting therapy with a DPP-4 inhibitor: sitagliptin 100 mg, oral once daily or vildagliptin 50 mg, oral, twice daily or saxaglitpin 5 mg, oral, once daily or linagliptin 5 mg, oral, once daily or alogliptin 25 mg, oral, once daily

intervention.description: Dapagliflozin or canagliflozin or empagliflozin add on to metformin ± basal insulin
Sitagliptin or vildagliptin or saxagliptin or linagliptin or alogliptin add on to metformin ± basal insulin

study_pop.textblock: Men and women with type 2 diabetes attending diabetes centers of the Campanian county treated with metformin and/or basal insulin who start therapy with a SGLT-2i or DPP-4i according to the clinical practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- type 2 diabetes for at least 5 years
- new use of an SGLT2-I or DPP4-I as add-on to metformin or insulin according to clinical practice
- HbA1c levels ≥ 7% and ≤ 8.5%
- eGFR ≥ 60 ml/min/1.73 m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes or secondary diabetes resulting from specific causes
- History of neurovascular ulcers
- Previous therapy with SGLT-2i or DPP4-i in the 3 months prior to the study enrollment
- History of cancer within the last 5 years
- Pregnancy or active breast-feeding
- Serum creatinine level ≥ 1.3 mg/dl in women and ≥ 1.4 mg/dl in men
- eGFR ≤ 60 ml/min/1.73 m2
